title.rendered: 7 websites to search the Internet without depending on Google

content.rendered:
We are not saying that these alternative search engines are better or worse than Google, but like everything in life, it is always worth it. know an alternative that we can use in certain cases. Even if you continue to keep Google as your default Internet search engine, do not lose sight of the following alternatives.

When we access a search engine, we always do it for our own benefit, either because we need some information or to know a place to download files, for example. With Ecosia, in addition to this, we will also be doing a very good deed if we use it.

80% of the revenue Ecosia generates through advertising goes entirely to to plant trees in some countries like Madagascar or Peru. This search engine will show us the results without any type of filter, although it will indicate with a green leaf next to the result when the website follows sustainable practices.

Every time we use your search engine we will see how in the upper right part of the screen appear the trees we are “generating”. If you want to take a cable to the environment while searching the Internet, always use Ecosia.

As we have said a little above, Google is the number one option (and number two too) of practically everyone. That’s because their algorithms work great to find anything on the internet, but it may be that if we want to look for something very specific, it is better to go to an alternative.

GIFs, emojis and others they have become very popular in recent years, and although you can of course Google them, it will take much less if you do it with Giphy. This website is great to search for what we want from this type of content, and it is practically impossible for you not to find what you are looking for.

Generally, what a search engine should do is show us results of all kinds that fit our search parameters. The less restrictions a search engine has, the better it will always be. except in Kiddle’s case.

This search engine is designed to be used by the smallest of the house and who want to satisfy their curiosity. Kiddle’s algorithms will avoid displaying those results that are not age appropriateand also its interface is more fun than Google’s, which is undoubtedly a claim for them.

If what you want is to learn English (or improve your level), Ludwig can come in handy. It is a search engine in the purest style of Google Translate, since what we will have to enter will be approximate phrases of what we want to search foreven if we don’t know how to write them correctly.

Ludwig will search for similar phrases in the most reliable sources, where even The New York Times, the BBC or The Guardian, just to give a few examples. It is a very fast search engine and it is undoubtedly great for our English to improve little by little.

Now that we live in a time where streaming platforms have gained a lot of weight in almost all homes, there is at least one subscription to one of them. know what we can see or not in each one it can be a bit heavybut to save you work there is JustWatch.

The best thing about JustWatch is that it gives us many different filters so we can search whatever we want, whether it’s by platform, by genre, or even by ratings on IMDB or Rotten Tomatoes. Using it is the simplest, and once you do it you will not go to another site to look for information of this type.

If, for example, we are looking for information to do a job, the most common thing is to go to Google. This search engine will give us above all contrasted results from articles or scientific journals, Leaving aside some posts that you consider to be “unreliable”.

This is precisely where Boardreader comes in. This search engine is perfect to search for more information than what Google gives us, since it will even show us results from forums or communities. Of course, this information may not be as reliable, although it is worth taking it into account.

We have left one of the best alternatives to Google for last if what worries you about this is the privacy of your data. Peekier does not record any personal information nor does it track our activity while we use it, something that we cannot say about other search engines.

Its interface is very simple, but practical. In the upper right part we have a complete range of options so that we can configure our searchesas well as a tab so you can read everything related to privacy if you still have questions.
